title: Reason one does not notice blind spot

content.prompt: A reason that one typically does not notice a blind spot in the visual field is that

choices.label: the blind spot is very small, and no visual stimuli are likely to be so small that the blind spot completely obscures them
most visual stimuli affect only one visual hemisphere, and one hemisphere can cover for the other
visual stimuli usually affect the occipital cortex in both hemispheres
the brain fills in missing information so there is no awareness that the visual field is incomplete

skill.text: 1.A: Apply psychological perspectives, theories, concepts, and research findings to a scenario.
